member.summary: Allows suggester to show notificatoins more or less often by overriding the time interval that is required to be passed since the previous suggestion.

member.name: T:JetBrains.IDE.FeatureSuggestion.NoSuggestionsIntervalAspect
member.summary: Allows suggester to show suggestion without requirements on time interval passed since the previous suggestion.

member.name: T:JetBrains.IDE.FeatureSuggestion.SuggestionShowsLimitAspect
member.summary: Allows suggester to set the limit on how many times it can show suggestions during session.

member.name: T:JetBrains.IDE.FeatureSuggestion.DisableWhenSuggestionAcceptedAspect
member.summary: Allows suggester to specify that after accepting its suggestion it should be disabled.

member.name: T:JetBrains.IDE.FeatureSuggestion.DisableByActivityUsageAspect
member.summary: Allows suggester to communicate that is should be disabled when certain usage statistics conditions are held.

member.name: T:JetBrains.IDE.FeatureSuggestion.OverrideCurrentSuggestionAspect
member.summary: Allows to cancel currently shown suggestion in order to show more prioritized one.

summary.para: Allows to publish your “result list” for IDE-global navigation with standard actions (in VS: “Edit.GoToNextLocation”, “Edit.GoToPrevLocation”).
Do this when you open a tool window with a list which should be walked when user invokes those commands right from the editor.

member.summary: The currently active result list, if published.

member.name: T:JetBrains.IDE.ResultList.UIResultListPublisherAutomation

summary.para: Helps with publishing result lists from UI components.
To be used in viewmodels. Bind to the view with a behavior for getting focus and keyboard events.

member.remarks: Behavior: See for possible states of publishing the result list. Initially, when the control is created, we'd publish the result list and keep it even on focus loss. After that, we'd publish our result list on any focus entry, but it would be revoked automatically on focus loss if there were no explicit user actions on items (like using the result list next/prev actions, or executing a node with Enter). But if there were, it's the same way as on control creation once again, until smb else pushes us out. This behavior seems to be the most friendly in terms of the implicit modality.

member.name: P:JetBrains.IDE.ResultList.UIResultListPublisherAutomation.IsKeyboardFocusWithin
member.summary: For binding from UI. Tells when actual keyboard focus is within the control. Controls the state. Unguarded, as this is for binding from UI.

member.name: P:JetBrains.IDE.ResultList.UIResultListPublisherAutomation.ItemExecuted
member.summary: For binding from viewmodel / UI. Fire this event when an item has been executed in the control. This means we should enter the state. Unguarded, as this is for binding from UI.

member.name: F:JetBrains.IDE.ResultList.UIResultListPublisherAutomation.ResultListByOwner
member.summary: The original result list, as provided by the owner of this object. This is NOT submitted to the .

member.name: F:JetBrains.IDE.ResultList.UIResultListPublisherAutomation.ResultListWrapped
member.summary: The wrapped result list created by this object which reports when an action is executed, so that to switch to when it happens.

member.name: P:JetBrains.IDE.ResultList.UIResultListPublisherAutomation.State
member.summary: The current state. Reflected into the global result list.

member.name: M:JetBrains.IDE.ResultList.UIResultListPublisherAutomation.ToString
member.summary: String representation, for diagnostic needs.

member.name: F:JetBrains.IDE.ResultList.UIResultListPublisherAutomation.PublishingState.NotPublished
member.summary: The result list is currently not published. Entry: (1) when someone else publishes a result list and pushes out our one, (2) when losing focus in state. Leave: on any entry event for other states.

member.name: F:JetBrains.IDE.ResultList.UIResultListPublisherAutomation.PublishingState.FocusPublished
member.summary: The result list has been published for the time while we have keyboard focus. Entry: control got focus ( going high) while in state. Leave: (1) control lost focus, (2) switched to due to an explicit user action.

member.name: F:JetBrains.IDE.ResultList.UIResultListPublisherAutomation.PublishingState.HardPublished
member.summary: The result list has been explicitly published, and should persist even when focus goes to another control (e.g. to text control when navigating to the next location). Entry: (1) control with a result list initially created, (2) an explicit user action, like executing result list actions in mode, or executing an item in the control with mouse or keyboard. Leave: someone has published another result list and pushed ours out.

member.name: M:JetBrains.IDE.UI.Extensions.BeLayouterExtensions.WithColumnsFeelingLucky(JetBrains.Rider.Model.UIAutomation.BeGrid,System.String)
member.summary: Converts this grid to a span grid with specified columns. Extracts all elements from the grid and puts them into span grid with the given sizes. If the columns size is greater than the number of elements inside the grid, and any element is * size - it will fill the remaining space.

member.name: T:JetBrains.IDE.UI.Extensions.TreeCheckBehavior
member.summary: Specifies how checking element in the tree affects its parent and child nodes.
member.remarks: The following properties are assumed by default and currently could not be changed: * checking/unchecking element checks/unchecks its children * unchecking some (but not all) children sets parent to indeterminate state * checking all children checks parent

member.summary: Custom implementation of validation rule which takes function for validation and applies it when value in control has changed. If locks are non null - rule is considered as guarded and will be executed under guard.

Can be null, in other case validation function will be executed under guard

member.name: T:JetBrains.IDE.UsageStatistics.ILicensedEntityUsageCheckerByProject
member.summary: Implement the component to count usages of product specific to project type. Make sure the component is marked with corresponding product zone so it is available if and only if the product is enabled.
